snippet: The Amore Opera’s presentation of “Olivo e Pasquale” was a rare chance to follow the story of two merchant brothers and a daughter who is in love with a clerk.
abstract: Zachary Woolfe reviews Amore Opera production of Donizetti opera Olivo e Pasquale, directed by Nathan Hull and starring Duncan Hartman and Jacopo Buora in title roles, at Connelly Theater.
lead_paragraph: The Amore Opera’s presentation of “Olivo e Pasquale” was a rare chance to follow the story of two merchant brothers and a daughter who is in love with a clerk.

headline.seo: ‘Olivo e Pasquale,’ From Amore Opera, at Connelly Theater
headline.main: A Daughter Has Suitors, but the Meddlers Are Determined
headline.print_headline: A Daughter Has Suitors, but the Meddlers Are Determined
